revised_title: Biological Control of Locusts and Grasshoppers using Fungal Pathogen: The Importance of Secondary Cycling
tldr: This study investigates the effectiveness of using the fungal pathogen Metarhizium flavoviride to control locusts and grasshoppers. The research demonstrates that secondary cycling of the pathogen after a single spray application provides a biological substitute for chemical persistence, making it an effective and environmentally friendly alternative to traditional chemical pesticides. The findings have significant implications for the economics of biopesticide use in pest control.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Environmental Science
